children.name: Prompt
children.text: Sense human and nonhuman needs to articulate challenges

children.name: Why
children.text: The needs and aspirations of people are not always voiced nor heard. The structuring power of institutions is often overlooked. Natural environments and their nonhuman inhabitants are routinely marginalised.

children.name: What
children.text: Human and nonhuman needs have shape, scale and density. Aspiration has pattern and texture. People, institutions, and their environments knit together with varying resolution and coherence.

children.name: How
children.text: Witness the everyday lives of individuals and communities. Feel for the rules and resources of social institutions. Map human-environment interdependencies. Acknowledge urgent demands for reform and intuit weak signals of change.

children.name: Why
children.text: Theory offers conceptual and comparative perspectives that reveal the context behind even seemingly novel and unique complex challenges.

children.name: What
children.text: Context is both specific and general. It provides a local setting for needs and aspirations, as well as a thick medium for the emergence of principles, concepts, and possibilities.

children.name: How
children.text: Collect and compare relevant contextual information to theorise the specific circumstances of a given challenge. Historicise and cite the information appropriately. Record how local issues were articulated, addressed, and addressed. Develop codes, rules and typologies that may be transmissible and adaptable to other settings.

children.name: Prompt
children.text: Gather best available data to shape solution spaces

children.name: Why
children.text: Complex challenges generate vast and diverse data trails. Gathering this data can help shape virtual spaces which are conducive for generating credible solutions.

children.name: What
children.text: Solution spaces set boundaries for effective experimentation. These boundaries are influenced by diverse, partial and often conflicting kinds of data. Therefore, solution spaces are necessarily hybrid, provisional, and flexible.

children.name: How
children.text: Critically evaluate available quantitative and qualitative data for coherence, currency, and compatibility. Clean, structure and curate data with appropriate privacy and sovereignty protections. Preserve the incommensurability of non-translatable data types, such as text, numbers, images, and audio. Identify any gaps in the data and supplement it with complementary sources.

children.name: Prompt
children.text: Experiment across solution spaces to generate robust ideas

children.name: Why
children.text: Robust ideas which are feasible scalable and adaptable to different contexts, audiences, and situations emerge from experimentation in conducive spaces

children.name: What
children.text: Robust ideas have the power to drive action. They are fostered by experimentation and fuelled by imagination. They transform perceptions into meaningful representations that can inform and guide potential courses of action in the world.

children.name: How
children.text: Make safe physical and social settings to foster creative risk-taking, openness and critical inquiry. Use heuristic or ‘satisficing’ approaches, especially where the solution space is broad and uneven, to encourage rapid iteration of ideas. Combine with more controlled experimentation in scientific, social scientific and creative research traditions.

children.name: Prompt
children.text: Situate ideas in the context of the problem

children.name: Why
children.text: Ideas are most effective when they are situated in the context of the problem. This helps to ensure that they are relevant, feasible, and scalable.

children.name: What
children.text: Ideas are most effective when they are situated in the context of the problem. This helps to ensure that they are relevant, feasible, and scalable.

children.name: How
children.text: Ideas are most effective when they are situated in the context of the problem. This helps to ensure that they are relevant, feasible, and scalable.

children.name: Prompt
children.text: Engage with stakeholders to refine ideas

children.name: Why
children.text: Ideas are most effective when they are situated in the context of the problem. This helps to ensure that they are relevant, feasible, and scalable.
